03 - Interactive Viz

Additional resources

This file provides some links to some interesting data visualization projects across the web. This list is not intented to be exhaustive, just to offer a reference for inspiration or information destined to the curious.

  • A map which takes its color scheme from images

  • Interesting map visualizations

  • Dataviz Blog by Mike Bostock, the creator of d3.js, a popular visualization tool for the web

  • Collection of interesting visualizations

  • Gene explorer, for biologists

  • Exploring 100k stars (Chrome only)

  • Interactive map of world trade over time

  • Visualizing deaths in conflicts across the world

  • Where did immigrants to the US come from over time ?

  • Listening to Wikipedia

  • A live map of Twitter

  • Collection of cool visualizations

  • A Choropleth map of Switzerland with mountains in relief

  • Interactive datavizualisations of the UK

  • Most used word in each state of the US (xkcd)

  • Drone deaths in Pakistan

  • Map projection transitions

  • The five main projects of the Belt and Road project in China

  • Full images of the Earth datastory

  • Surprise! Showing the unexpected
